newsitem.title: CROATIA: SOCCER-SUSPENSION FORCES SUKER OUT OF CROATIA-SLOVENIA QUALIFER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SUSPENSION FORCES SUKER OUT OF CROATIA-SLOVENIA QUALIFER.

text.p: Croatia will miss several key players, including top scorer Davor Suker, for Wednesday's World Cup qualifier against underdogs Slovenia.
Croatia, currently third in the tightly-bunched group one, must beat the visitors, who have lost their three opening qualifiers, to keep the pressure on Greece and Denmark who top the group.

Croatia drew 1-1 with Denmark on Saturday -- their second home slip after managing only a 1-1 draw with Greece -- and anything other than a win on Wednesday would leave them fcing an upward struggle to qualify for the 1998 World Cup in France.
"We have to beat the Slovenes. We are in a difficult position now, plagued by injuries, and we cannot afford any more slips," coach Miroslav Blazevic said.

Suker, Croatia and Real Madrid's top scorer, will miss the game after picking up a second yellow card on Saturday while stopper Zvonimir Soldo of VfB Stuttgart is out after injuring a knee in the same game.
Goran Vlaovic of Valencia will take Suker's place in the attack next to Alen Boksic of Juventus, while young defender Dario Simic of Croatia Zagreb is a most likely substitute for Soldo.
There is no place for goalkeeper Drazen Ladic, blamed for the mistake which allowed Brian Laudrup to equalise eight minutes from the end of Saturday's match with a long-range speculative shot.
Ladic will be replaced by Hajduk Split's Tonci Gabric.
Earlier last week, Blazevic was left without defenders Igor Stimac of Derby County and Mario Stanic of Parma because of injuries.
To add to Blazevic's problems, Robert Jarni is doubtful with a back injury.
The Slovenes believe they can upset the Croatians playing a defensive game and looking for breaks on the counter-attack.
"It is true that Croatians are favourites and that the quality of their team is better. But if we could surprise Austria, why we could not do it to Croatians.

"Our goal is at least a point, but it will be no tragedy if we lose," coach Zdenko Verdenik said. Slovenia beat Austria 2-0 in a recent friendly. Probable line-ups: Croatia: Tonci Gabric; Nikola Jerkan, Slaven Bilic, Dario Simic, Robert Jarni, Niko Kovac, Aljosa Asanovic, Zvonimir Boban, Robert Prosinecki, Alen Boksic, Goran Vlaovic Slovenia: Bosko Boskovic: Robert Englaro, Miran Srebrnic, Ales Krizan, Dzoni Novak, Marinko Galic, Ales Ceh, Saso Udovic, Zlatko Zahovic, Primoz Gliha, Ermin Siljak.
